details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Welcome back! This is your last training session. After that, you will be ready for real action.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Today we are joined by a Commando - Sergeant Blake. He will be helping me in teaching you about Hero units.

details.name: Sergeant Blake
details.text: Always glad to help new recruits!

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Hero units are a special type of unit. They are very though and deal a lot of damage, though their mobility is below average.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: More importantly, Hero units have passive and active abilities. Let's start with the passive one.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Every hero, when present on the battlefield, gives you a passive benefit. Commando has the Trained Specialist ability, which makes cooldowns for active abilities of your units 1 turn shorter. Thanks to this, your veteran units become even more valuable.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Try using your Artillery unit to clear some tiles on the other side of the forest.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Good. Now open the ability radial of your Artillery unit again. You will notice, that turns left to cool down the ability is 1 instead of 2. You can end your turn, reposition your Artillery and strike again.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: In the meantime, a field on the other side of the forest opened up. Move Blake there using his active ability Infiltration. If you already used his active ability, just wait a few turns for it to cool down.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Commando ability allows you to reach places otherwise inaccessible, or hard to get to. You can bypass obstacles such as forests, mountains and buildings, as well as enemy units, and reach your target.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Remember, that different Heroes have different abilities. Some of them will target specific units or tiles. Some of them might target Heros themselves in order to be used, like the ones that give benefits to units in certain radius around the Hero.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: There is an enemy Infantry unit guarding our HQ. Have Blake take it out.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Excellent performance Sergeant.

details.name: Sergeant Blake
details.text: Thank you, Sir!

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Now let's claim this building.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: That will be all for now, Sergeant. You are dismissed.

details.name: Sergeant Blake
details.text: Yes Sir!

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: On some missions, the hero will be there from the beggining, and loosing one might fail your missions. But in a typical skirmish, you will have to deploy your Heroes from your HQ building.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Time for me to stretch my legs. Go ahead and deploy me from this HQ.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: With me on the battlefield, thanks to my Recruitment passive ability, all Infantry and Mobile Infantry units can be deployed for 10AP less. This effect applies both to HQ and Barracks. Go on and deploy an Infantry unit from HQ - you should notice, that it only costs 30AP instead of typical 40AP.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Infantry is my specialty, so make sure to call on me, when you plan on using a lot of them.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: As for my active ability, it is called Deep Strike, and it allows me to call in a paratrooper, that will land up to two tiles away from me. It can be very useful, when you have reached the enemy base, but lost all of your Infantry units in the process.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Just make sure that landing zone is safe, as this new unit is not going to be able to act until next turn.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Go on and try using my ability. If you already did that before, wait a few turns and use it again.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Good job. That should give you an overview of Hero units and their abilities.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Every Nation has thier own, unique Heroes, with their own unique abilities, so be on your guard, as you never know what will happen, when one of them shows up.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: One final note.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: On some missions you might be required to protect a non-combatant unit. As an example, here we have Sapphire Dawn President Gideon. Units like him are called NPC units. They are a bit tougher than regular Infantry, so you don't have to worry, that they will die from a single attack. They are not as tough as Heroes, though. And they can not fight.

details.name: President Gideon
details.text: Wait, what happened? I was in my office, and then suddenly...

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: Let our dear President get back to work.

details.name: General Cyrus
details.text: You have successfully completed your training. Good luck, and see you on the battlefield. Dismissed!
